summary: "My own heroes are the dreamers, those men and women who tried to make the world a better place than when they found it, whether...
body:
“My own heroes are the dreamers, those men and women who tried to make the world a better place than when they found it, whether in small ways or great ones. Some succeeded, some failed, most had mixed results… but it is the effort that’s heroic, as I see it. Win or lose, I admire those who fight the good fight.”

- George R. R. Martin

*~*~*~*

If this doesn’t describte Daenerys Targaryen and Jon Snow, I don’t know what does.

summary: Passion (a gift for @alittlestardustcaught) [tags: Jon/Sansa, modern AU, ballet AU, banter, first time] Sansa loves to dance...
body:
Passion

(a gift for @alittlestardustcaught)

[tags: Jon/Sansa, modern AU, ballet AU, banter, first time]

Sansa loves to dance ballet, to perform each night, she imagines every member of the company does - for why else would they do it? - every member, that is, except for her sullen new partner, Jon.

She has never seen someone cross the floor with such hatred, pirouette like he loathes the music cue, fling himself into the air in front of the audience as if his body is saying fuck you.

You don’t get involved with a man like that, she thinks, as he lowers her from the lifts each night, firm hands on her waist and dark eyes fixed on hers, you shouldn’t let his bitterness become yours.

Willas was her last partner - her Romeo, her Prince Charming, her Hilarion, her Solor - but after he was injured the company had brought in Jon for her, not Jaime Lannister like she had wished, not even Theon Greyjoy who would have been just about acceptable. No, they brought in Jon Snow, he of the brooding looks, he of the difficult moods and slovenly clothes, he of “the raw sensuality the company has lacked in recent years,” the frenzied news reports had announced, to Sansa’s disbelieving scoffs.

[read more]

summary: “A crown should not sit easy on the head. One of her royal forebears had said that, once. Some Aegon, but which one? Five Aegons...
body:
So Speaks the Queen

“A crown should not sit easy on the head. One of her royal forebears had said that, once. Some Aegon, but which one? Five Aegons had ruled the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros. There would have been a sixth, but the Usurper’s dogs had murdered her brother’s son when he was still a babe at the breast. If he had lived, I might have married him.”

- Daeneerys Targaryen (Daenerys I ADWD)

summary: Jon x Reader Requested by Anon Prompt Lists  “We’ll freeze if I can’t find something to start this fire with.” Jon said as he...
caption:
Jon x Reader

Requested by Anon

Prompt Lists

“We’ll freeze if I can’t find something to start this fire with.” Jon said as he pulled his cloak around himself, trying to find anything that could light the pile of wood he found. Having been tasked with finding a witch willing to help the rangers he’d hoped it wouldn’t be so difficult and that he would be able to get back to camp in the same day.

“I’ll do it.” You muttered taking the logs off and leaving one, handing him the handful of fire starting twigs he’d managed to find. “Better use this all sparingly.” You suggested as sparks flew from your hands and the single log burst into gentle flames.

“How’d you do that?” He muttered in surprise.

“First rule of witch club: don’t talk about witch club.” You said with a laugh. He grunted and nodded, you were willing to help him and he shouldn’t pry he decided as you both settled around the odd fire.

summary: I keep hearing all the time that Sansa was Jon’s most trusted, influential adviser. Like when? Sometimes I wonder if I am...
body:
I keep hearing all the time that Sansa was Jon’s most trusted, influential adviser. Like when? Sometimes I wonder if I am watching an altogether different show.

Sansa: Punish these Umber and Karstark children for the sins of their fathers

Jon: No. I will forgive them and get their loyalty that way.

Sansa: Cersei is the greater threat. Focus on her

Jon: No. She can’t get to us here in the North. WW are more dangerous

Sansa: Listen to my advice. Don’t do stupid things like Ned

Jon: LOL! Ned is the best.

Sansa: Don’t go south. Mad King killed our family members

Jon: I am going south. I need weapons and men.

I can’t think of any one single piece of advice from Sansa that Jon took. In fact Sansa complains of this very thing to Littlefinger - “He never asked for my opinion. Why would he start now?”. Sansa resents Jon for not taking her advice and LF uses this to manipulate her.

And I can’t even blame Jon considering how Sansa lies to him, keeps information from him and even questions his decisions in front of the lords.

Jon did leave Sansa in charge of WF, trusting that she would do a good job and not backstab him when he left, because she was the only Stark left in WF. There was no one else he could entrust WF to.

blog.description: HE LOVED HER AND SHE LOVED HIM

body:
Unburnt

A Jonerys One-Shot, Part 2

Check out Part 1: https://reddragon1995.tumblr.com/post/178838029955/a-jonerys-one-shot-part-one

A smutty enough Jonerys sex boat fic, set in the same universe as my previous one. Rated mature. Please reblog and comment. A Tumblr exclusi

“You are, but…”

She cocked a teasing eyebrow. “You thought that Unburnt was a figure of speech.”

Jon ran a hand through his raven black curls, shaking his head. “I don’t know what I thought.”

Dany propped herself up on her elbows, her robe falling away, and instinctively he placed a hand on one breast, lightly kneading the plump mound. “What happened?” he whispered. “How did you know you could do that?”

“I just knew. I used to dream I could.”

He listened in awe as she peeled away one more layer of the mystery of Daenerys Targaryen, stroking her hair while with unquestioned trust she told him of her husband’s funeral pyre, and how she had knowlingly walked into the inferno, only to emerge unharmed, with three baby dragons.

“You’re a damn magical woman, you know that?” he whispered against her forehead, placing a kiss there.

She shrugged. “The blood of Old Valyria. There is power in that blood, but power isn’t of my blood alone.” Her eyes fell pointedly upon his scarred chest, and his breath hitched. He still had not confessed to her what happened, how he received those scars, for each time he considered it, he felt the stabs of pain and betrayal anew. Jon knew Daenerys was no fool. She had to know his wounds were mortal, yet he lived and breathed. Mercifully, she had not asked him more about it. Perhaps he owed the truth to her, considering what she had just revealed to him, but before he could speak, she flipped him onto his back and sat astride his chest, leaning over him, her breasts dangling just out of reach of his mouth, her hair falling over her shoulders, the ends brushing his skin. “Now, Jon Snow,” she practically sang, “tonight, you belong to me.”

“I belong to you every night, until my last on this earth.” The words had left him before he could consider their brevity. Dany sat upright, the sultry smile dying from her lips, her expression inscrutable, and for a moment Jon was panicked. Did she not feel the same? He was so certain she did. The way she held him, the way she nested in his arms while they slept, the way she KNEW him, body and soul….these were not intimacies shared with a mere bedwarmer. But then he saw her eyes glisten, perhaps with welling tears, like he’d seen when he woke to find her keeping watch at his bedside after they’d departed The Wall. He lifted his hand to cup her cheek, and she leaned into that touch, closing her eyes and clasping her hand around his.

“I know,” she whispered, “as I belong to you.”

His heart leapt. He guided her head toward his and his lips found hers, kissing her sweetly, reverently, tenderly as he was wont to do. He could not help but treat her as though she were made of the most fragile glass, despite his darker desire to take her hard with abandon, the Dothraki way, as she called it.

“So what does my Queen command of me?” he murmured against her lips. “Shall I murder someone? Perhaps remove Lord Tyrion’s tongue, the gods save us all?”

She chuckled. “There will be no need to remove any tongues…though I trust you shall make good use of yours.”
